Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2013 07:06PM lynnms3 wrote: So sorry about what you are going through. The waiting is the worse. My kids were 10, 15 and 17. We waited until after the first lumpectomy and knew what the plan was before we told them. We actually never told the youngest the entire truth, just a sugar coated version since I did not need chemo. I guess the best thing I did was just take it day by day. Try not to overwhelm yourself. Try and get rest, it will make it easier to deal with. Lean on your support system, they want to be there for you. Prayers for you. You will get through!
Posts.Title: 43, Mother of 2 Young Boys and Scared! Tr8cyg DC197

Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2013 04:47PM lynnms3 wrote: So sorry about your diagnosis.  I also had ILC.  Small size is good.  Your children are certainly old enough to be told.  We waited until we had all of the information from the testing - biopsy, MRI, etc before we told the older ones.  For my younger one we actually never told him the full story just a sugar coated version.  We will tell him at a later point.  I did not need chemo so it made things a little easier.  We actually chose to tell very few people because I just did not want this in my face day in and day out.  Only immediate family and a few close friends.  Take things day by day and you will get through.  Try and get some decent sleep, it will make things easier to deal with if you are rested.  I will pray for you!
